name: Lateral Raises
how_to_perform:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides, palms facing your thighs.
2. Keeping your arms straight and squeezing your shoulder blades together, lift the dumbbells out to the sides until they are at shoulder height.
3. Focus on keeping your shoulders down and away from your ears as you lift the weights.
4. Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position, then repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
5. Keep your movements slow and controlled throughout the exercise.
short_summary: Lateral raises are an upper body exercise that targets the deltoids and is typically performed with dumbbells.
